questions.question_text: A bank offers you a Certificate of Deposit (CD) with a three-year maturity with a stated annual interest rate of 8% compounded quarterly and allows you to reinvest the interests at the same rate. The worth of the CD at maturity if you invest $150,000 now is closest to:
questions.question_text_ru: Банк предлагает депозитный сертификат со сроком 3 года под 8% с квартальным начислением. Какова стоимость при погашении, если вложить $150,000?
questions.explanation: FV with quarterly compounding: FV = PV[1 + rs/m]^(mN) = $150,000[1 + 0.08/4]^12 = $190,236.27

opt1.text: FV with annual compounding instead of quarterly.

questions.question_text: An investor wants to invest $600,000 in an asset paying a 5% interest compounded continuously for four years. The value of the investment in 4 years is closest to:

questions.explanation_ru: Для непрерывного начисления: FV = PV × e^(rN)

opt1.text: FV with annual compounding.

options.text: Higher than the arithmetic mean return value
Lower than the arithmetic mean return value
The same as the arithmetic mean return value

questions.explanation: With volatility, geometric mean is always less than arithmetic mean due to volatility drag.

opt3.text: Equal only when returns are constant.
